intro: Hylotelephium telephium, commonly known as the sunset rose, is a perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, rose-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing a range of colors from pink to red, and it is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. Hylotelephium telephium is also known for its ability to propagate through both seeds and vegetative means.
